column1: 1983GeoRL..10..833K|1983|Compositional implications regarding the lunar origin of the ALHA81005 Meteorite|Kallemeyn
column5: ALHA81005 has all the attributes expected of a regolith sample from the lunar highlands. Most important is its Fe/Mn ratio (77)
column6: within uncertainty the same as the mean lunar ratio. There are significant differences
column8: in comparison to previously sampled lunar regoliths. The closest precedents are the Apollo-16 and Luna-20 regoliths
column10: but ALHA81005 has lower contents of Na
column12: and incompatible elements. Feldspathic granulitic breccias such as 72559
column13: which texturally resemble the most abundant type of clast in ALHA81005
column14: are also similar compositionally. From its low KREEP and Na contents we infer ALHA81005 originated well away from the K
column16: and U-rich region near the center of the nearside
column17: at least as far away as the eastern limb.|http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/GL010i009p00833

column1: 1980LPSC...11..591W|1980|Significance of major and minor element variations in plagioclase in sodic ferrogabbro and breccia matrix in lunar highlands sample 67915.|Weiblen
column7: Jr.|Lunar and Planetary Science Conference Proceedings|1||591|Attention is given to the significance of the results of a study of Ca
column12: and Mg variations in plagioclase in highlands sample 67915
column13: 84. This polymict breccia from Outhouse Rock station 11 at the Apollo 16 site has been selected for study because it contains a wide variety of clast types
column14: including a differentiated type-sodic ferrogabbro. It is found that the data on Ca
column19: and Mg in plagioclase show no evidence of reaction between sodic ferrogabbro and breccia matrix clasts. Two groups of plagioclase compositions have been recognized in the breccia matrix. The data suggest that the prebreccia characteristics of plagioclase compositions have been preserved in 67915. Data on Mg/(Mg+FE) ratios suggest that the sodic ferrogabbro and the intermediate-Ca plagioclase clasts could be related to the Mg-rich plutonic rock suite and the high-Ca plagioclase clasts to the ferroan anorthosites.|
